intro: Chloidia polystachya, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chloidia polystachya is often used in ornamental gardening due to its drought tolerance and attractive appearance.
